sections.name: Demon Lord, Vulot
sections.text: Vulot is nascent demon lord of lies, loss of identity, and suffocation. If one of their forms is ever destroyed, they are able to reincorporate as one of their many stolen identities a day later.

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Large
traits.text: *Space:* 10 feet, *Reach (Tall):* 10 feet, *Reach (Long):* 5 feet

traits.name: Demon
traits.text: A family of sinful fiends from the Outer Rifts.

traits.name: Fiend
traits.text: Creatures that hail from or have a strong connection to the unholy planes are called fiends. Fiends can survive the basic environmental effects of planes in the Outer Sphere.

traits.name: Mythic
traits.text:
Options with this trait grant or utilize mythic power. Feats with the mythic trait can only be taken by mythic characters, who are typically characters with a mythic Calling.  
  
 Monsters with the mythic trait have access to a pool of Mythic Points and are particularly strong for creatures of their level. Many mythic monsters are either resistant or entirely immune to attacks from non-mythic creatures and weapons.  
  
 Spells with the mythic trait require the expenditure of a Mythic Point in order to be cast, and items with the mythic trait require the expenditure of a Mythic Point in order to use their activated abilities.  
  
 Weapons with the mythic trait overcome the resistances and immunities of mythic monsters.

traits.name: Unholy
traits.text: Effects with the unholy trait are tied to powerful magical forces of cruelty and sin. They often have stronger effects on holy creatures. Creatures with this trait are strongly devoted to unholy causes, and often have weakness to holy. If a creature with weakness to unholy uses an unholy item or effect, it takes damage from its weakness.

communication_abilities.name: all languages spoken by their collective identities

modifiers.name: unlimited range to other stolen identities worn by cultists of Vulot

universal_monster_ability.name: Telepathy
universal_monster_ability.text: A monster with telepathy can communicate mentally with any creatures within the listed radius, as long as they share a language. This doesn't give any special access to their thoughts and communicates no more information than normal speech would.

traits.name: Aura
traits.text: An aura is an emanation that continually ebbs out from you, affecting creatures within a certain radius. Aura can also refer to the magical signature of an item.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

interaction_abilities.name: Absolute Surety
interaction_abilities.text: Vulot is dependent on deception and charm to achieve their goals. If Vulot fails to deceive someone, for example failing the Deception check associated with a *mislead* spell to convince an observer that an action came from the duplicate, Vulot takes 4d6 mental damage. This damage ignores Vulot's usual immunity.

interaction_abilities.name: Many Eyes in Many Places
interaction_abilities.text: Vulot can extend their senses through any cultist wearing one of their stolen identities as long as the cultist is in the Universe or the Outer Rifts. Vulot can't maintain their attention through more than three cultists at one time. Vulot can't speak through these cultists.

automatic_abilities.name: Another Face
automatic_abilities.text: When Vulot is reduced to 0 Hit Points, they regenerate themself from a stolen identity of their choice in 24 hours. If Vulot has no stolen identities remaining or is otherwise unable to reach them, they are killed permanently.

automatic_abilities.name: Mythic Immunity
automatic_abilities.text: Vulot is immune to harmful spells cast by non-mythic creatures, Strikes made with non-mythic weapons, and unarmed Strikes from non-mythic characters.

automatic_abilities.name: Suffocated by a Thousand Breaths
automatic_abilities.success: ; The creature becomes short of breath and is off-guard until the beginning of its next turn.
automatic_abilities.failure: The creature finds it very difficult to catch its breath. It can't speak or use auditory actions until the beginning of its next turn; this prevents it from casting spells that don't have the subtle trait.
automatic_abilities.critical_failure: All the air immediately leaves the creature's lungs and it begins to suffocate. When it succeeds at the saving throw to regain consciousness at the end of its turn, it becomes fatigued until it gets a full night's rest.

traits.name: Aura
traits.text: An aura is an emanation that continually ebbs out from you, affecting creatures within a certain radius. Aura can also refer to the magical signature of an item.

traits.name: Incapacitation
traits.text: An ability with this trait can take a character completely out of the fight or even kill them, and it’s harder to use on a more powerful character. If a spell has the incapacitation trait, any creature of more than twice the spell’s rank treats the result of their check to prevent being incapacitated by the spell as one degree of success better, or the result of any check the spellcaster made to incapacitate them as one degree of success worse. If any other effect has the incapacitation trait, a creature of higher level than the item, creature, or hazard generating the effect gains the same benefits.

automatic_abilities.text: Vulot's breath-stealing influence radiates out from their body, causing victims to feel like they are being smothered. Any creature that starts its turn within the aura must attempt a DC 41 Fortitude save.

automatic_abilities.name: Perfect Mimicry
automatic_abilities.trigger: A spell is cast within 60 feet of Vulot
automatic_abilities.effect: Vulot copies the spell and may cast it once by spending a Mythic Point within the next 24 hours. Vulot can't hold more than two copied spells at one time.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still calculate damage using Strength.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Unholy
traits.text: Effects with the unholy trait are tied to powerful magical forces of cruelty and sin. They often have stronger effects on holy creatures. Creatures with this trait are strongly devoted to unholy causes, and often have weakness to holy. If a creature with weakness to unholy uses an unholy item or effect, it takes damage from its weakness.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

traits.name: Range
traits.text: These attacks will either list a finite range or a range increment, which follows the normal rules for range increments.

traits.name: Unholy
traits.text: Effects with the unholy trait are tied to powerful magical forces of cruelty and sin. They often have stronger effects on holy creatures. Creatures with this trait are strongly devoted to unholy causes, and often have weakness to holy. If a creature with weakness to unholy uses an unholy item or effect, it takes damage from its weakness.

mythic_activations.name: Recharge Spell

traits.name: Concentrate
traits.text: An action with this trait requires a degree of mental concentration and discipline.

mythic_activations.effect: Vulot gains an additional use of any of their innate spells.

mythic_activations.name: Remove a Condition

traits.name: Concentrate
traits.text: An action with this trait requires a degree of mental concentration and discipline.

mythic_activations.effect: Vulot removes any one condition currently affecting them.

ability.name: Steal Face
ability.effect: Vulot makes a claw Strike. On a hit, Vulot attempts a Deception check against the target's Will DC to steal that creature's face; on a critical hit, Vulot treats the result of their Deception check as one degree of success higher. On a success, Vulot steals the target's face for 1d4 rounds (1 minute on a critical success); a creature whose face has been stolen isn't considered an ally by any creature.

ability.name: Steal Thoughts

traits.name: Emotion
traits.text: This effect alters a creature’s emotions. Effects with this trait always have the mental trait as well. Creatures with special training or that have mechanical or artificial intelligence are immune to emotion effects.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

ability.success: The creature becomes stupefied 1 for 1 round.
ability.failure: The creature becomes stupefied 1 for 1 minute. If it's already stupefied, its stupefied value increases by 1 instead (to a maximum of stupefied 4).
ability.critical_failure: As failure, plus the creature is confused for 1 minute.
ability.text: Vulot's mental attacks can confuse and disorient. A creature struck by Vulot's thought spike must attempt a DC 44 Will save. A creature stupefied by this effect is off-guard to Vulot's Steal Face ability.
